lexUnit.name: hide.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: be in a state of obstructing an object from view

sentence.text: When I looked back again , just before the trees hid the house , he had disappeared .
The council houses , of fudge-coloured brick , stood in two rows and a horseshoe shape with a screen of Leyland 's cypress hiding them from the village .
They watched until the cloud hid him from view .
He discovered houses in Milton Street where seemingly plain facades hid huge gardens or impressive extensions to the rear .
A thick hedge of cypresses hid the pool from the lawns that led up to the house .
The hills beyond the town were hidden by cloud , and the sea was rough as the wind freshened .
It was a strange sort of progress , because the mist hid the water ; hid , even , our horses ' heads .
Neither of these showed the sea-level view from an assault craft , when the ` white house " reference point for a beach could be hidden by trees .
Pedestrians going down the steps from the bus stop are hidden by trees and shrubs and have to either walk in the road or cross over to find a pavement .
He tried to pull Caspar with him so that they would be hidden by a tree , but Caspar hung back barking .
The moon was now hidden by clouds as Ellie turned and looked back out of the window .
The ground rose slightly , then dipped ; after a hundred yards or so a shallow outcrop of rocks hid the house .
It was partly hidden by cypress trees and a high hedge , but the sign had been newly painted in dark green , and there was no doubting it : Thorn House .
Although it was morning the scene shimmered , a haze hid hills beyond the valley .
The nearest naked-eye star to the pole is Sigma Octantis , but as it is below the fifth magnitude it will be hidden by mist or moonlight .
The rectory , now in non-ecclesiastical ownership , is a long pale , yellow building opposite the church , with a tall hedge half hiding it from view .
More easily now , he made his way along the roof-tops , hidden from sight by the forest of chimney stacks .
Two young urchins , their faces completely hidden by hoods , came hurrying by , kicking an inflated pig 's bladder before them .
` Every time I look at it I see some detail for the first time -- a tiny insect on a stone , a bird half hidden by foliage , a shadow which yesterday escaped me .
They may be openly on display , or totally hidden by pubic hair .
A long porch partially hid the squat front door , its arched cover all over tangled creepers , the grass and pavings all about it thick with weeds .
He glanced round again , but the Thing , the Beast , the Monster , or whatever it was , was hidden from his sight by the smoke it shot out as it galloped forward .
IRAS will scan the Milky Way for the first two or three months , concluding with passes over the centre of the galaxy -- a strong infrared source hidden from optical astronomers by dust .
His wrists up to his elbows were closely covered with coral bangles , so were his ankles … his breast was completely hidden from view by the coral beads encircling his neck .
It was parked next to the wall and almost hidden from view by the red Studebaker beside it .
